```{r setup, include=FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
```
```{r}
radio_data <- read_csv("/Users/zoeskigen/Desktop/radio.csv")
head(radio_data)
```
```{r}
radio_data$`Playlist Date` <- as.Date(radio_data$`Playlist Date`, format = "%B %d, %Y")

genre_over_time <- radio_data %>%
     group_by(`Playlist Date`, Genre) %>%
     summarise(Song_Count = n(), .groups = 'drop')

# Enhanced plot
ggplot(genre_over_time, aes(x = `Playlist Date`, y = Song_Count, color = Genre)) +
  geom_line(size = 1.2) +  # Thicker line
  geom_point(size = 2, shape = 21, fill = "white") +  # Add points with white fill
  scale_color_brewer(palette = "Set1") +  # Color palette for better distinction
  labs(title = "Trend of Genres Over Time",
       subtitle = "Analysis of song genres played over time on the radio show",
       x = "Date",
       y = "Number of Songs",
       color = "Genre") +
  theme_minimal() +  # Minimal theme
  theme(plot.title = element_text(face = "bold", size = 14),
        plot.subtitle = element_text(face = "italic"),
        legend.position = "bottom",  # Adjust legend position
        legend.title = element_text(face = "bold", size = 10),
        legend.text = element_text(size = 8),
        axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1))  # Improve x-axis labels readability

# Print the plot
print(genre_over_time_plot)

```
```{r}
# Faceted plot
ggplot(genre_over_time, aes(x = `Playlist Date`, y = Song_Count, color = Genre)) +
  geom_line(size = 1) +
  facet_wrap(~ Genre, scales = "free_y") +
  labs(title = "Trend of Genres Over Time", x = "Date", y = "Number of Songs") +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1))
```
